sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Angel Studios Approves 2026 Executive Compensation Plan
feed.summary: Angel Studios, Inc. (ANGX) has approved its 2026 executive compensation plan, effective January 1, 2026. This plan includes base salary adjustments and grants of Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) and Performance-Based Restricted Stock Units (PSUs). The RSUs will vest in installments from December 2026 to November 2028, and PSUs will vest based on stock price performance milestones over ten years.

feed.title: Angel Studios Inc. Reports $14M Presales for DAVID
feed.summary: Angel Studios Inc.'s animated musical "DAVID" has achieved $14 million in theatrical presales, demonstrating strong audience interest and exhibitor participation. This significant increase from earlier presale figures precedes its nationwide release on December 19, 2025. The company's stock, ANGX, currently holds a Buy rating with a target price of $9.00 from analysts.

feed.title: Angel Studios board approves 2026 compensation for CEO including equity grants
feed.summary: Angel Studios' Board of Directors has approved 2026 compensation for CEO Neal Harmon, including a base salary of $550,000 and significant equity grants which include restricted stock units (RSUs) and performance-based restricted stock units (PSUs). These compensation adjustments, detailed in a recent SEC filing, are part of the company's 2025 Long-Term Incentive Plan, with vesting contingent on employment and stock price milestones. Similar compensation updates were also approved for President Jordan Harmon and CFO Scott Klossner.

feed.title: Angel Studios Approves 2026 Executive Compensation Plan
feed.summary: Angel Studios, Inc. (ANGX) approved executive compensation plans for 2026, which include adjusted base salaries and grants of Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) and Performance-based Restricted Stock Units (PSUs). RSUs will vest in installments from December 2026 to November 2028, while PSUs are tied to stock-price performance over ten years. The company currently has a Buy rating from analysts with a price target of $14.00.

feed.title: Angel Announces Upcoming Conference Participation
feed.summary: Angel (NYSE: ANGX) announced its participation in two upcoming December investor conferences. Co-Founder and CEO Neal Harmon and CFO Scott Klossner will have a fireside chat at the Wedbush Digital Content Forum on December 9, 2025, and Angel's management team will hold one-on-one meetings at the 14th Annual ROTH Deer Valley Event from December 10–13, 2025. Investors can find details for viewing the fireside chat and requesting meetings through their respective Wedbush or ROTH representatives.

feed.title: ANGX signs mergers for Tuttle Twins, Wingfeather Saga and Homestead
feed.summary: Angel Studios (ANGX) has announced definitive agreements to acquire three of its top-performing series: Tuttle Twins, The Wingfeather Saga, and Homestead. These acquisitions will be stock-based deals, primarily involving Angel Class A common stock, consolidating key content into wholly-owned subsidiaries. The mergers are subject to various approvals and have outside dates in March and June 2026, with Angel having previously provided significant funding to the acquired entities.

feed.title: The Price Is Right For Angel Studios, Inc. (NYSE:ANGX) Even After Diving 28%
feed.summary: Angel Studios' shares have seen a significant 28% drop in the last month, contributing to a 53% decline over the past year. Despite this, the company maintains a high price-to-sales ratio of 3.7x, which is considerably higher than the industry average. This elevated P/S ratio is attributed to strong past revenue growth of 110% last year and a forecast of 34% growth next year, outperforming the industry's 23% projection.

feed.title: Angel Studios Announces Joint Venture with 2521 Entertainment
feed.summary: Angel Studios has announced a joint venture with 2521 Entertainment to acquire the DAVID franchise from Slingshot USA, which includes an animated feature film set for a December 2025 release and a television series. This partnership resolves a lawsuit and aims to expand Angel Studios' content offerings in values-driven storytelling. The company, Angel Studios Inc Class A (ANGX), currently holds a Buy rating with a $14.00 price target from analysts.

feed.title: Angel and Shining Isle Reveal Season 3 Trailer of The Wingfeather Saga - Gospel Music Association
feed.summary: Angel (NYSE: ANGX) and Shining Isle Productions have released the official trailer for Season 3 of _The Wingfeather Saga: The Ice Prairies_, premiering November 12, 2025, exclusively on Angel platforms. The new season delves deeper into the world of Aerwiar as the Wingfeather family faces significant trials, including journeys through perilous landscapes and imprisonment. The series, based on Andrew Peterson's bestselling fantasy novels, is one of the largest crowdfunded family animated series ever produced.

feed.title: Angel and Shining Isle Productions Reveal the Official Trailer for Season 3 of The Wingfeather Saga: The Ice Prairies - PR Newswire
feed.summary: Angel and Shining Isle Productions have released the official trailer for Season 3 of "The Wingfeather Saga: The Ice Prairies," set to premiere on November 12, 2025, exclusively on Angel platforms. This season will follow the Wingfeather family as they face new challenges, with Janner journeying to the Ice Prairies and Kalmar imprisoned. The series, based on Andrew Peterson's novels, continues as one of the largest crowdfunded family animated series, showcasing themes of family, perseverance, and courage.

feed.title: Angel and Shining Isle Productions Reveal the Official Trailer for Season 3 of The Wingfeather Saga: The Ice Prairies - WV News
feed.summary: Angel Studios and Shining Isle Productions have released the official trailer for Season 3 of "The Wingfeather Saga: The Ice Prairies," set to premiere on November 12, 2025, exclusively on Angel platforms. This season continues the story based on Andrew Peterson's bestselling fantasy novels, focusing on the Wingfeather family's trials across the perilous Ice Prairies. The crowdfunded animated series, which has raised over $7 million from fans, utilizes a new Unreal Engine animation pipeline to achieve its ambitious visual scope.

feed.title: Angel Studios, Inc. Securities Lawsuit Investigation
feed.summary: Shamis & Gentile P.A. is investigating potential securities fraud claims against Angel Studios, Inc. (ANGX) following its public debut in September 2025. The investigation focuses on alleged misleading statements and omissions regarding the company's financial health and a significant stock resale filing that may have contributed to substantial investor losses. Investors who purchased Angel Studios securities and suffered losses are encouraged to review their legal rights and potential for compensation.

feed.title: Angel Studios (ANGX): chief experience officer Taylor Seth buys $192 in stock
feed.summary: Angel Studios' Chief Experience Officer, Taylor Seth, purchased 11 shares of Class A Common Stock for a total of $192 on September 11, 2025. This transaction increased his direct holdings to 4,505 shares, despite the stock having significantly declined from its 52-week high and being considered overvalued by InvestingPro analysis. Separately, Angel Studios filed a prospectus for existing shareholders to potentially sell up to 10,042,523 shares, with the company not receiving any proceeds from these sales.

feed.title: ‘Sound of Freedom’ Distributor Angel Studios Closes Deal to Become Publicly Traded Company Valued at $1.6 Billion
feed.summary: Angel Studios, known for its values- and faith-based content and the hit film "Sound of Freedom," has completed a merger to become a publicly traded company. The deal with Southport Acquisition Corp., a SPAC, values Angel Studios at approximately $1.6 billion. Its shares are expected to begin trading on the NYSE on September 11 under the ticker symbol "Angx."

feed.title: Angel Studios, Inc. Class A Common Stock (NYSE:ANGX) Stock Quote
feed.summary: This page provides a stock quote and financial information for Angel Studios, Inc. Class A Common Stock (NYSE:ANGX), showing its current price, trading volume, and performance metrics. It also includes a list of recent news headlines related to the company, covering financial results, acquisitions, and project announcements. The article details key stock data like open, bid, ask prices, and 52-week range, alongside frequently asked questions about the stock's public trading status and exchange.

feed.title: Angel Studios (ANGX): Assessing Current Valuation After Recent Share Price Momentum
feed.summary: Angel Studios (NYSE:ANGX) has seen significant share price momentum recently, with its stock climbing 22% over the past year and 19% year-to-date. Despite this, the company trades at a high price-to-sales ratio of 18.5x, much higher than the US Entertainment industry average of 1.9x, and remains unprofitable with declining revenue. Both P/S analysis and a DCF model suggest the stock is currently overvalued, with a fair value estimated at $13.26.

feed.title: Angel Studios Goes Public: Will Investors Buy Into the Entertainment Business’ Faith-Friendly Outsider?
feed.summary: Angel Studios, known for faith-based and value-centric films like "Sound of Freedom," has gone public under the ticker symbol ANGX after a SPAC merger, aiming to disrupt Hollywood with its crowd-funded model. The company's stock rose by 10% on its first day of trading, and its CEO Neal Harmon expressed ambitions to significantly grow its Angel Guild membership and continue its mission of amplifying light through storytelling. The move allows Angel Studios to maintain control over its mission and content greenlighting process, avoiding potential hostile takeovers.

feed.title: Angel Studios Shares Close Up 8.4% in Stock Market Debut, CEO Sees Big Audience of ‘People Who Think Hollywood Gatekeepers Are Out of Touch’
feed.summary: Angel Studios made its stock market debut, with its shares closing up 8.4% on the NYSE. CEO Neal Harmon highlighted the company's "values-based" entertainment approach, which involves 1.5 million paying subscribers who actively vote on greenlit projects. Harmon stated that Angel Studios caters to an audience feeling underserved by traditional Hollywood, focusing on content that promotes "what is good, beautiful and worth sharing.”

feed.title: Angel Studios to Begin Trading Today as ANGX
feed.summary: Angel Studios, a media and technology company, has completed its D-SPAC merger with Southport and will begin trading today on the NYSE under the ticker ANGX. The company successfully maxed out JOBS Act crowdfunding at $75 million and secured a $100 million credit line, leveraging its 1.5 million "Guild" members for content approval and demand forecasting. This unique model of democratic content curation and community-backed financing aims to reshape how media is financed and produced.

feed.title: Angel Studios, Inc. Completes Business Combination with Southport Acquisition Corporation
feed.summary: Angel Studios, Inc. announced the completion of its business combination with Southport Acquisition Corporation. The combined company will trade on the NYSE under the ticker symbol "ANGX" starting September 11, 2025. This milestone is set to accelerate Angel Studios' growth in values-based storytelling and expand its Angel Guild membership.

feed.title: ‘Sound of Freedom’ Distributor Angel Studios Closes Deal to Become Publicly Traded Company Valued at $1.6 Billion
feed.summary: Angel Studios, known for faith-based content and hits like "Sound of Freedom," has completed a SPAC merger with Southport Acquisition Corp., valuing the combined entity at $1.6 billion. The company is set to begin trading on the NYSE under the ticker "ANGX" and will continue to be led by co-founder Neal Harmon. Despite increased revenue, Angel Studios reported a net loss for the first half of 2025 due to marketing expenses for its Angel Guild membership program.

feed.title: Angel Studios, Inc. Completes Business Combination with Southport Acquisition Corporation
feed.summary: Angel Studios, a media and technology company known for its values-based content, has completed its business combination with Southport Acquisition Corporation and will begin trading on the NYSE under the ticker "ANGX" on September 11, 2025. The company, led by CEO Neal Harmon, leverages a community of 1.5 million "Angel Guild" members to select and greenlight content, and has secured a $100 million credit facility to support its expansion. This move marks a significant milestone for Angel Studios, providing access to public markets and capital for accelerated growth.
